title: Ukraine’s long-awaited counteroffensive
description: A much-anticipated Ukrainian counteroffensive against Russia is underway. But as Samantha Schmidt reports from the beleaguered city of Kherson, a push for liberation from Russian occupation is just the beginning.

title: Berlusconi’s testosterone-filled politics have been overtaken by women in Italy
description: With Giorgia Meloni as the first female prime minister and Elly Schlein the first woman to lead the center-left opposition, Italian politics looks very different.

title: Bunga-bunga bromance: Berlusconi was one of Putin’s best pals in Europe
description: The longtime leaders of Italy and Russia had bonded over displays of machismo, including ski trips. And Putin reportedly once gave Berlosconi, known for hosting wild parties, a bed as a gift.

title: Ukraine says counteroffensive has liberated four villages in Donetsk
description: Ukrainian forces said they reclaimed the villages of Neskuchne, Storozheve, Blahodatne and Makarivka. The gains, if confirmed, would show progress for Kyiv.

title: Philippines’ most active volcano spews lava, prompting thousands to flee
description: Mount Mayon in the Philippines’ Albay province is spouting lava and sulfuric gas. Authorities told tens of thousands of people to prepare to evacuate.

title: Mother told kids to leave Colombia plane crash site for help, family says
description: Rescuers found the children 40 days after their plane crashed into the remote Amazon jungle. Their father says their mother initially survived the impact.

title: World leaders mark death of Berlusconi, Italy’s polarizing ex-prime minister
description: From Giorgia Meloni to Viktor Orban, world leaders issued statements about former Italian prime minister Silvio Berlusconi following his death.

title: Silvio Berlusconi, Italian leader and billionaire media mogul, dies at 86
description: He dominated and divided his country for decades through a combination of showman charm, scofflaw bombast and ruthless application of financial and political power.

title: The Nile is the world’s longest river? The Amazon would like a word.
description: A new expedition wants to set the record straight.

title: U.S. seeks to expand developing world’s influence at United Nations
description: The evolving proposal would address growing frustration with the U.N. Security Council’s inability to stanch global conflicts, particularly the war in Ukraine.

title: American musician detained in Russia on drug charges
description: Michael Travis Leake, a U.S. expatriate living in Russia, was arraigned on Saturday in Moscow, according to the State Department.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kyiv claims gains in counteroffensive; U.S. musician arrested on drug charges in Russia
description: The arrest of Michael Travis Leake is the third known instance of an American being detained in Russia since the invasion. Leake is accused of selling drugs.

title: Wedding bus crash kills at least 10 in Australia; driver arrested
description: At least 10 people were killed and 25 injured when a bus carrying wedding guests crashed in the Hunter Valley wine region. Charges are pending, police said.
